p: In this study, we have selected the two pancreatic digestive proteases trypsin and chymotrypsin to observe their behavior in the presence of different concentrations of ethanolic and aqueous extracts of E. cyparissias (Figures 4(a) and 4(b)). The inhibitory effect of the two extracts was compared to that of the positive control with BBI [ 47]. These results were in line with those obtained previously by Huang et al. [ 48] who demonstrate that the phenolic compounds partially inhibit trypsin and a residual activity of trypsin was always maintained at 32%.
